title: Understanding Strong vs. Weak Acids
text: A strong acid dissociates completely in water, while a weak acid only partially dissociates. Look at the number of undissociated molecules (HA) compared to dissociated ions (A⁻ and H₃O⁺) in each image.

title: Analyzing Acid A
text: In the image of Acid A, observe the proportion of HA molecules to A⁻ and H₃O⁺ ions. Does it look like most of the acid is dissociated or undissociated?

title: Analyzing Acid B
text: In the image of Acid B, observe the proportion of HA molecules to A⁻ and H₃O⁺ ions. Does it look like most of the acid is dissociated or undissociated?

title: Analyzing Acid C
text: In the image of Acid C, observe the proportion of HA molecules to A⁻ and H₃O⁺ ions. Does it look like most of the acid is dissociated or undissociated?

title: Identifying the Weak Acid
text: Which acid shows a significant amount of undissociated HA molecules compared to dissociated ions?
